comment: absolutely peak professor, literally everyone has heard about him and I'm letting you know the glaze is warranted. He's experienced in the field and asks about what the students want in the future. Even if your techniques are diff from his, he never makes you draw his way. In addition, you don't have to be good at drawing to be in this class!

Amazing Professor!! If you're about to take Foundation Animation or any other animation course that he teaches take him!! He's patient, will help you with assignments, and he's super passionate about animation and he'll help you succeed. He will make sure you know everything you need to know about being an animator!

The best professor I have ever taken. This man is thorough in teaching you about animation, he gives excellent feedback throughout the semester, he's incredibly passionate about animation and about teaching it, and you are guaranteed to leave his class a better animator and artist. He is the sole reason I changed my concentration. Take him!!!!!!!!!

In all my years of grade school and college, I have never met a teacher who was more passionate about their job than Professor Malone. He makes it known at every opportunity how proud he is of SOAAD students and he fights tooth and nail to make sure we art students have what we need to thrive. I eagerly look forward to taking him again.

Absolute gem of a human being, teachers like him are few and far between. Genuinely loves his students and is kind and understanding. Gives very concise and effective feedback. Loves to spark discussions with students and discuss the animation industry in general. Easily one of my favorite teachers at KSU.

I took him for Fundamentals of Anim and I'm so glad he was my professor. He does a great job of teaching the intro projects and preparing you for your future animation classes! I always got such great feedback from him and he's always willing to help. He also goes out of his way to inform you about the animation industry which awesome! 10/10

Updated with trends & what's current in the field. Is really passionate & prepares students. Don't leave assignments to do last minute, trust me. Actually teaches Toon Boom Harmony. 2 extra credit opportunities (weekly news & posting social media). Usually won't reply to emails because he is very busy and you should follow up with him in person.

Chris was the best & most caring teacher I have ever had! He graded nicely but not too easily. He really cared about his students learning and their overall well-being. A bunch of us were close to him and even went out to eat with him! He cares about you even if you aren't his student and wants to help everyone that asks him.

I took him for both Computer Apps and Sequential Art I. Super nice, patient and unique guy. He offers great feedback on how to improve your work and is really knowledgeable about what he teaches. I always had so much fun in his class and he was great to talk to about cartoons, dogs and movies (among other things). Mr. Malone is just a swell dude.

Honestly one of the best teachers I have ever had! Overall a charismatic fun teacher! I would highly recommend him as he is an experienced artist and teaches in a fun and easy way. I seriously loved this class and learned so much about digital media and how much I love it.

I struggled with computers and fallowing directions, but Professor Malone was so patient and helpful that I figured it out. He makes this class fun. Then I started liking computer based arts, and would do it for fun if I had more time. He's a hard grader, neat and nit-picky and hard to get a B, but he is worth taking. He's one of my favorites.
Professor Malone is a wonderful person who really cares for his students. Always positive and ready to help. VERY patient which is so important for this class. 10/10 recommend him!!!

He's an inspirational and fun professor. We did a lot of cool projects. He was very willing to help if we were struggling with adobe since it was new to most of us. I felt comfortable asking him any questions. I want to do more digital art because of his class and would definitely take him again. Very nice and funny but still very professional.

New professor with industry experience. He was very open to sharing what it's like working in the field of art. You will learn a lot, but not in an overwhelming way. He's a very laid back, nice, and chill person. When I took his class, I had a lot of issues that semester and he was extremely understanding.
